Text.Value: I tired of doctrine and dogma. I wanted freedom.
Your resolve changes with the wind, oathbreaker. Speak.
Speak, oathbreaker. I will hear you.
Without light to guide you, or darkness to consume, you will remain adrift. Powerless.
A lapse in judgement.
A silent betrayal.
Who are you?
I can't afford it. Isn't there some other way?
But you have fallen, and it seems you do not fully comprehend the reason why.
This is the cost of your transgression.
It is possible.
When I finally saw the truth, he would not be reasoned with. So I ended him. For this, I was called 'Oathbreaker'.

EditorData.NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

Text.Value: Speak, oathbreaker.
I'm a child of Bhaal - how could I ever have become a paladin?
Newfound wisdom. A sense of clarity.
I will become an oathbreaker once more.
That was a brave decision. It can't have been easy.
To know the reason for your fall is, perhaps, to know the shape of things to come.
Resolve. Purpose. These will serve you well on your journey.
Only in wielding the powers I lost can I achieve my aims. It is my destiny. My right.
Then the path to redemption remains closed. Only when the gold is paid can your oath be reclaimed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

Text.Value: First, you must pay the agreed price. Material sacrifice is required, to prove your words have substance.
I don't need your help, stranger. I can look after myself.
You swore to protect life itself. To serve the natural order. To protect those who value life, and vanquish those who would destroy it.
Then hold to your oath. Let it be a comfort and a guide.
I served a noble lord. I fought for him without question or restraint. Where his light shone, my sword followed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

Text.Value: It was the bounty placed on an oathbreaker's head. It was the sum placed on my own.
I had no choice. To follow it was to act against my conscience.
Until that day, I will be here, and my offer will remain.
Darkness will obey your summons. The dead will march to your rhythm.
When you feel ready to make it, I will be waiting for you.
What powers do I have as an oathbreaker?
I knew the consequences would be worse for those he continued to harm.
Your offering is accepted. Kneel.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player hands the gold to the Oathbreaker NPC. At the moment the gold is transferred, the player finds themselves back in the Oathbraker dimension. They drop to one knee, their head bowed.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker

Text.Value: For casting aside your oath, you will be reclaimed.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. The Oathbreaker NPC raises their hand towards the player, as a flash of light transitions us to the oathbreaker dimension, a strange void rippling with dark fogs and turquoise vapours.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker

Text.Value: You may refuse. But this alone will not restore what was lost.
I seek moral guidance. It cannot be found lurking in the shadows.
That is your choice. I will be here, should you reconsider.
Though born of a vile source, these powers can be used for good or ill.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. Under the Oathbreaker's command, the vapours approach the player, swirling around them. gathering speed. The player looks around, uncertain, as they are enveloped. The oathbreaker speaks -

Text.Value: That was a brave decision. It can't have been easy.
Leave.
Tell me more about these powers.
Did you know you would be cast out?
A journey with no end, trodden only by the desperate and the damned.
Do you regret betraying your oath?
If you stumble, know there is no shame in falling. Only release.
The Oath of Devotion is once more yours to fulfil.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. At the oathbreaker's instruction, the player reaches towards the glowing orb. The orb moves closer to their hand, the glow intensifying before a blinding flash takes us to the character creation screen. (Player never visibly makes contact with orb)
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] The orb glows brighter, ending in a flash to white

Text.Value: A desire for purity. Moral absolution.
It is a path I have walked since the moment I fell. Now you will walk it too.
Why am I allowed to reclaim my oath, knowing what I am?
Ask what you will.
Without gold, your pledge cannot be made. Return to me when you are ready to pay.
Regret is for those who would act differently. I feel no such desire.
In the darkness, new power beckons. In the light, the promise of restoration. But in between, there is nothing.
I come to offer solace. And warning. For the way is soaked in the blood of the desperate and the damned.
Abandoning my oath tainted my soul. I wish to make it right.
I hope to lead a life without Bhaal again.
I understand better the meaning of my oath. I can serve it now, as I could not before.
Tell me, why do you wish to reclaim your oath?
I don't want this. I want to remain pure.
Repairing what was damaged. Atoning for the past.
You may still reclaim your oath. So long as you are willing to pay. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

EditorData.NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

Text.Value: Pay the gold. Reclaim your oath. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
It was not my intention. My actions had unexpected consequence.
Returning to your oath means relinquishing the darkness within you. Its evil must be banished.
The Oath of the Ancients is once more yours to fulfil.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. At the oathbreaker's instruction, the player reaches towards the glowing orb. The orb moves closer to their hand, the glow intensifying before a blinding flash takes us to the character creation screen. (Player never visibly makes contact with orb)
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] The orb glows brighter, ending in a flash to white
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] The orb glows brighter, ending in a flash to white

Text.Value: You are between worlds, paladin. Have you made a choice?
The Oath of Vengeance is once more yours to fulfil.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. At the oathbreaker's instruction, the player reaches towards the glowing orb. The orb moves closer to their hand, the glow intensifying before a blinding flash takes us to the character creation screen. (Player never visibly makes contact with orb)
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] The orb glows brighter, ending in a flash to white

Text.Value: In that case, I accept. I will become an oathbreaker.
Take comfort in your undoing. I, like you, abandoned my cause. But much can still be achieved.
Why should I pay more? I did no worse than before.
You swear to act with strength, compassion, and responsibility. To be a paragon of honour and justice.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the oathbreaker speaks, a glowing orb slowly manifests in front of the player. The player looks up at it, determined.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] A glowing orb manifests in front of the player

Text.Value: What oath did you swear?
Oathbreaker. What do you need of me?
I offer no riddles. Nor do I offer clarity. Where you must walk, there are no signposts. There are no maps.
There are less worthy objects demanding a far higher price. For redemption, this is no great ask.
I no longer believed in its teachings.
You called to me. I am here to show you the way.
Do not resist. Surrender, and be remade.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The oathbreaker raises their arm towards the player. A blinding flash transitions us into the oathbreaker dimension, a strange void filled with dark fogs and an unnatural turquoise light. Turquoise 'oathbreaker' vapours ripple and stir restlessly around the Oathbreaker NPC.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker

Text.Value: The gold must be paid.
Turning on your own people? No wonder you were cast out.
What's past is past. We are here to discuss your future.
What did you achieve after abandoning your oath?
It is what you do, not what you are, that determines your oath.
A loss of purpose.
If you believe your oath to be of lesser value, you are under no obligation to reclaim it. It is your decision.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

Text.Value: It is wise to first consider what is gained, and what is lost in the bargain.
I felt the moment of your liberation - the shedding of your bond.
I wish to take up my oath again.
Your oath is broken. The light within you fades. A new power is awakening.
I want to become an oathbreaker.
What happens if I reclaim my oath?
I wish to take up my oath again.
Powerless? I don't like the sound of that.
It is a decision worthy of consideration.
To exist outside the confines of his doctrine was something I welcomed. It was no punishment.
Eventually, I heard the call of others who had strayed. I showed them the way, as I show you now.
Did I break my oath before, when I went to the Temple?
It is possible, but such a promise must not be made lightly. Wealth must be sacrificed, and your soul re-pledged.
Tell me - why did you abandon your oath?
I have been waiting for you.
I am a poor paladin - my mind is shattered and cruelty is within.
Even now, these shadows gather around you. They sense the cracks in your armour. They yearn to be used, to be inflicted.
Yes, and not for the first time. We have met before. I expect we will meet again.
Do you regret betraying your oath?
Cruelty need not conflict with purpose, and a shattered mind may yet uphold an oath.
You swore to deliver vengeance, to hunt down those who had wronged and ensure they felt the sting of justice.
It was merely a choice. As I have made countless others since.
May you wield the darkness well.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. The Oathbreaker NPC is barely visible through the growing maelstrom whipping around the player. As the final words of their warning ring out, the player shields their eyes against a blinding flash, transitioning them to the character re=spec screen.

Text.Value: This is your fate. Your right. Oathbreaker.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the Oathbreaker NPC speaks, the vapours swirl and circle around the player.

Text.Value: Oathbreaker.
I'm in no mood for riddles. Whatever you have to say, spit it out.
I need time to think about it.
Your oath stands firm. Should you stumble, I will be waiting.
Did you know what it meant to break your oath like that?
I will not be tainted. I will find a way to reclaim my oath.
You swear to defend life itself, to protect all that is good and natural, and to repel wickedness wherever it threatens.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the oathbreaker speaks, a glowing orb slowly manifests in front of the player. The player looks up at it, determined.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] A glowing orb manifests in front of the player
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] A glowing orb manifests in front of the player

Text.Value: Buying salvation sounds like cheating to me.
Kneel, oathbreaker.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The Oathbreaker holds out a hand, as the player finds themselves back in the Oathbraker dimension. They drop to one knee, their head bowed.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] Oathbreaker specific Vision VFX intro, vapours rippling around the Oathbreaker

Text.Value: A higher purpose. A greater calling.
I can't afford that.
Hand over the gold. Reclaim your oath. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
My actions followed no teaching apart from my own justification. Good or ill, I made my choices.
Nobody belongs entirely to their bloodline, even those fathered by a god.
I wielded the powers of darkness, yet held a candle for those who needed the light.
A noble sacrifice.
Oaths are not to be discarded and reclaimed without cause. Your inconstancy bears a cost.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

Text.Value: Your oath no longer binds you - the choice is yours alone.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. The Oathbreaker NPC is barely visible through the growing maelstrom whipping around the player. As the final words of their warning ring out, the player shields their eyes against a blinding flash, transitioning them to the character re=spec screen.
EditorData.VFXTags: [KC] vision effect intensifies, ends on flash to white

Text.Value: I was the first. The first to swear. The first to fall.
I'm ready. I will become an oathbreaker.
You swear to deliver righteous retribution, vanquishing your enemies and aiding those who suffer at their hands.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Oathbreaker Dimension. As the oathbreaker speaks, a glowing orb slowly manifests in front of the player. The player looks up at it, determined.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KC] A glowing orb manifests in front of the player

Text.Value: Do you wish to pay? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
You chose a path, made a pledge, and Bhaal had no part in it.
Hand over the gold. Reclaim your oath. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
Why did you abandon your oath?
The way to what?
Your oath-sworn powers will return. You will be bound again by the decrees you promise to uphold.
Isn't there any way to reclaim my oath?
You swore to defend the defenceless, to stand as an emblem for all that is good and just in this world.
I owe you no explanation. My reasons are mine alone.
Leave.
With each transgression, your burden grows. As does the price of redemption.

EditorData.NodeContext: Keep this neutral - he's not telling you off, just stating the facts

Text.Value: I'll remain as I am.
When another's oath is broken, I stand witness. I hear their sorrow. I see their jubilation. I guide their hand.
Should you wish to do so, speak with me again.
Murdering your own lord? No wonder you were cast out.
In his name, I razed villages, put thousands to the sword. I believed our greater purpose required such brutality, such sacrifice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

Text.Value: Your coffers are empty. The price must be paid.
The powers you wielded were not yours alone. They were a gift, offered on the condition that your oath was upheld.
But his light was so radiant, it blinded me to all else. I could not see the darkness and corruption of the path he led me down.

EditorData.NodeContext: Controlled, explaining events that have long since lost their emotion

Text.Value: State your purpose, oathbreaker.
The price is paid.
A shedding of responsibility.

Synopsis:
When a paladin becomes an oathbreaker the Oathbreaker knight will appear to be their guide. He will stay at the camp as a camp follower.
If a non-oathbreaker paladin speaks to the Oathbreaker, they begin a short interactive dialogue. The Oathbreaker is mildly impressed that they are still dedicated to their cause, but warns that the course ahead will test their commitment.
